description: Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders is holding a rally in Ohio Thursday, seeking to bolster support for an upcoming ballot initiative to raise the state's minimum wage to $15 an hour.
title: Bernie Sanders to hold rally in Ohio for $15 minimum wage initiative

description: Former President Donald Trump isn't shying away from speculation that North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum is on his shortlist for vice president. A new report from Axios reveals the Trump campaign believes Burgum could help close the deal in several swing states. Axios politics reporter Sophia Cai and CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett join to discuss.
title: Unpacking speculation over Trump's VP short list

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a state visit to North Korea this week, during which he and Kim Jong Un took significant actions to deepen their countries' partnership. The leaders signed an agreement pledging mutual aid in the event of aggression against either of their countries. CBS News foreign correspondent Imitiaz Tyab explains.
title: Breaking down the significance of North Korea-Russia partnership

description: As both presidential candidates aim to mobilize Latino voters, President Biden's campaign manager, Julie Chávez Rodriguez, spoke to CBS News political director Fin Gomez about the Biden administration's recent immigration plans.
title: Biden campaign touts new immigration policy

description: With five months until the presidential election, Americans are sharply divided. But it's not just federal office holders facing vitriol and toxicity. CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns discusses how local officials are facing rising threats.
title: Local officials face rising threats across U.S.

description: President Biden is expected to head to Camp David tomorrow to begin his debate preparations, while former President Donald Trump's prep is expected to be more informal. Meanwhile, a source says the White House canceled a meeting with Israel over Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's claim that the U.S. is withholding weapons. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
title: President Biden to prep for debate at Camp David

description: Scientists studying a Colombian family plagued by early-in-life Alzheimer's have found a rare gene variant that seems to delay initial symptoms by about five years.
title: Family's genes offer new clue to delaying Alzheimer's disease

description: American Airlines CEO Robert Isom wrote a letter to employees outlining steps the company will take to address racial discrimination.
title: American Airlines CEO vows to "rebuild trust" after removal of Black passengers

description: As the U.S. celebrates Juneteenth, there is still disagreement over proposals for reparations for African Americans following generations of systematic injustice at the hands of local and federal institutions. Justin Hansford, a commissioner for the National African American Reparations Commission and law professor at Howard University, joined CBS News to discuss.
title: Debate over reparations continues in U.S. communities

description: President Biden has announced a major expansion of the Parole in Place program, which will provide protections and a possible pathway to citizenship for about 500,000 undocumented immigrant spouses of American citizens. CBS News' Lana Zak explains how it would work.
title: What to know about Biden's new immigration policy and who qualifies

description: Louisiana became the first state to require the Ten Commandments to be displayed in every public school classroom. Republican Gov. Jeff Landry signed the bill into law Wednesday.
title: Louisiana governor signs law requiring Ten Commandments be displayed in classrooms

description: According to a Federal Reserve bank survey, the average level of wealth in Black households was a little over $200,000, while White households averaged over $1.3 million. A new book, "Fifteen Cents on the Dollar: How Americans Made the Black-White Wealth Gap," examines this wealth disparity and details the structural economic barriers that Black Americans face. The co-authors of the book, Louise Story and Ebony Reed, joined CBS News to discuss.
title: Examining the racial wealth gap in the U.S.

description: Baseball fans around the world are mourning the passing of Willie Mays, one of the greatest to ever play the game. He died Tuesday at the age of 93. Grant Brisbee, a staff writer for The Athletic who covers the San Francisco Giants, joined CBS News to discuss Mays' legacy.
title: The impact Willie Mays had on and off the baseball field

description: CBS News identified two new fabricated videos by a Russian disinformation network targeting Americans traveling to the Paris Olympics.
title: Russia targets Americans traveling to Paris Olympics with fake CIA video

description: The hiker was bitten in the Sierra Nevada by what she thought was a spider, Inyo County search and rescue officials said.
title: Hiker rescued from California mountains after paralyzing bite

description: A cyber attack has disrupted the transaction systems for 15,000 car dealerships across the U.S.
title: CDK cyber attack shuts down auto dealerships across the U.S.

description: A record-breaking heat wave is intensifying in the Northeast and Midwest. CBS News reporter Jordan Burrows has the latest from Detroit, one of the places facing extreme heat.
title: Heat wave intensifies in the Northeast, Midwest

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un signed an agreement vowing to build a strong front against the West and deepening their military ties. Kim also expressed full support for Putin's war in Ukraine. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab has more.
title: What the Putin-Kim Jong Un partnership agreement could mean

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accused the U.S. of withholding weapons from his military. The Biden administration says it doesn't know what the prime minister is talking about. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay reports from Tel Aviv.
title: White House disputes Netanyahu's claim that the U.S. is withholding weapons from Israel

description: The 2024 Summer Olympics are just a month away, where the best athletes in the world will compete against each other. But there's one opponent that has the potential to outshine the performance of everyone – the heat. This year's Games could break records, and scientists and athletes around the world are concerned that as temperatures continue to rise, it could put the health of the competitors – and the future of the event as we know it – in jeopardy.
title: The heat will be on at the 2024 Summer Olympics – and for athletes, it could be dangerous

description: The GOP-drafted legislation mandates that a display of the Ten Commandments in "large, easily readable font" be required in all public classrooms.
title: Louisiana law requires Ten Commandments be displayed in classrooms

description: Parts of Texas are facing heavy rain and flooding from Tropical Storm Alberto, the first named storm of the Atlantic hurricane season. CBS News national correspondent Dave Malkoff has the latest from Corpus Christi, Texas.
title: Tropical Storm Alberto causing rain, storm surge in Texas

description: Ferrari's foray into the EV space comes as other automakers are slashing prices on the cars amid faltering demand.
title: Ferrari has plans for an electric car. The cost? More than $500,000.

description: Republican groups are pushing GOP voters to embrace early and mail voting — while Trump sometimes calls mail ballots "treacherous."
title: Trump, GOP urge early and mail voting while continuing to warn of voter fraud

description: Two adolescent boys in a Paris suburb have been given preliminary charges of raping a 12-year-old girl and religion-motivated violence, French authorities said Wednesday.
title: Protests after alleged antisemitic gang rape of 12-year-old girl in France

description: Officials said the drugs, which were found in the water about 7 miles off Islamorada, Florida, were handed over to U.S. Border Patrol agents.
title: Boaters find over $1 million of cocaine floating at sea off Florida Keys

description: Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi rebels have attacked ships in the Red Sea since November, claiming the strikes are retaliation against Israel and its allies.
title: Second ship attacked by Yemen's Houthi rebels sinks in the Red Sea

description: Mary Delgado spent $14,000 on IVF to have her second child. Her story highlights the financial challenges many Americans face when seeking the fertility treatment.
title: IVF costs put the fertility treatment out of reach for many Americans

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is accusing the U.S. of withholding weapons. The Biden administration paused one shipment of bombs to Israel in May over concerns of their possible impact on densely-populated areas, but the White House said it has not withheld others. Meanwhile, Israel's foreign minister is warning about the prospect of war with the Hezbollah militant group. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay is following the latest from Tel Aviv.
title: Israel official warns of possible war with Hezbollah

description: The red-bellied black snake slithered onto the unicorn-themed bed in Jimboomba, Queensland, and tried to blend in with some toys — but it couldn't hide for long.
title: Venomous snake found hidden among girl's stuffed animals

description: A venomous red-bellied black snake was removed from a home in Australia after it was discovered curled up in a child's bed. Red-bellied black snakes are one of the most frequently encountered snakes on the east coast of Australia, and are responsible for a number of bites every year, according to the Australian Museum.
title: Snake catcher removes venomous snake from child's bed

description: At least one person has died as a result of the out-of-control wildfires burning in the southern part of New Mexico. The South Fork and Salt Fires prompted New Mexico's governor to declare a state of emergency for some areas. CBS News correspondent Omar Villafranca has the latest.
title: New Mexico issues state of emergency amid deadly wildfires

description: Longtime customers of a men's shirt company are now buying clothes two sizes smaller, its owner said.
title: Ozempic is fueling demand for smaller clothing sizes

description: A new policy proposal from the White House offers legal protections to some undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens. The plan would prevent them from facing deportation while making it easier for them to apply for work visas and permanent residency. CBS News immigration reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez breaks down how the program would work.
title: Who would be eligible for citizenship in Biden's new immigration policy?

description: Former President Donald Trump is holding a campaign fundraiser Wednesday in Ohio, a state represented by Senator J.D. Vance, one of Trump's possible running mate candidates. CBS News campaign reporter Olivia Rinaldi has more on the relationship between Trump and Vance.
title: Why J.D. Vance is on the short list for possible Trump running mates

description: While 1-ounce gold bars can be a smart investment for seniors, there are times they may want to avoid this route.
title: When seniors should invest in 1-ounce gold bars (and when they shouldn't)

description: Hall of Famer Ken Griffey Jr. said of Willie Mays: "He'll always be the godfather of all center fielders."
title: How Willie May inspired generations, on the field and off

description: If you're buying this type of coverage in your 70s, you can adjust different policy levers to keep costs down.
title: Buying long-term care insurance in your 70s? Do this to keep costs down, experts say

description: A possible tropical storm is building in the Gulf of Mexico and is already causing powerful winds and strong currents along the South Texas coast. A Tropical Storm Warning was issued for the coast, as far north as the San Luis Pass. CBS News' Dave Malkoff is in Corpus Christi with more.
title: Tropical storm warning issued for parts of Texas

description: If you need to handle your card debt, you may be able to reduce it or work out a more manageable repayment plan.
title: Need your credit card debt to be written off? 3 options to consider

description: State of emergency issued in New Mexico due to wildfires; communities gather across U.S. to celebrate Juneteenth.
title: 6/19: CBS Morning News

description: In an unexpected twist, the daughter of victim Leslie Preer revealed that she once dated the suspect.
title: Stunning twist after man arrested in woman's cold case murder

description: Across the U.S., celebrations have been taking place for Juneteenth, the federal holiday marking the end of slavery. The day marks when the last enslaved people learned they were freed in Galveston, Texas, in 1865, more than two years after the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation. Alana Wise, a race and identity reporter for NPR, joined CBS News to discuss the holiday.
title: How communities are celebrating Juneteenth

description: Primary voters went to the polls Tuesday in Oklahoma, Georgia and Virginia. In Virginia, a contentious Republican primary between Rep. Bob Good, who voted to oust House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, and Virginia State Sen. John McGuire, endorsed by former President Donald Trump, was too close to call on election night. CBS News political reporter Hunter Woodall has more on the primaries.
title: Contentious Republican primary in Virginia too close to call

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals,  Elizabeth Werner shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Jason Biggs joins "CBS Mornings" in the studio to discuss how he's cooking up something sweet to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the iconic movie "American Pie."
title: Jason Biggs talks "American Pie" celebrating 25th anniversary

description: Black Restaurant Week celebrates Juneteenth by highlighting over 3,000 Black chefs and restaurants across the country, including Brooklyn Chef Hollis Barclay's Bleu Fin Bar and Grill.
title: Juneteenth celebration highlights Black chefs, restaurants nationwide

description: Across the U.S., more than 3,000 restaurants and chefs have participated in Black Restaurant Week. In New York City, the week coincides with Juneteenth, and many chefs are offering Juneteenth-inspired menus. CBS News' Jericka Duncan introduces us to one of those chefs for "The Dish."
title: The Dish: Black Restaurant Week highlights thousands of chefs, restaurants

description: The "Facing Fertility" series explores the soaring costs of IVF during World Infertility Awareness Month. With an average cost of $20,000 per round, IVF is out of reach for many. CBS News' Nikki Battiste shares the story of one woman who faced financial and emotional challenges after Medicaid denied coverage for her treatments.
title: How families cope with the financial cost of IVF

description: The Just Stop Oil group says two activists "decorated" the ancient Stonehenge monument with "orange powder paint."
title: Activists spray Stonehenge in orange paint, demand end of fossil fuel use

description: Biden's campaign manager says his newly announced policy on undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens shows he's "fighting for issues that matter to them and to their families."
title: White House touts new Biden immigration policy

description: With executions halted, California is transferring death row inmates to other state prisons, reshaping the prison system. "CBS Mornings" got an inside look at the changes.
title: Inside look at California's plan to dismantle death row at San Quentin prison

description: Willie Mays, known as the greatest center fielder of all time, was also a friend to former MLB player Harold Reynolds. Reynolds talks to "CBS Mornings" about Mays' legacy.
title: Harold Reynolds on Willie Mays' legacy, favorite memories

description: Officials say 11 people were injured, some of them critically, when a house collapsed in Syracuse, New York. Witnesses described hearing an explosion. The cause of the incident is under investigation. CBS News' Anne-Marie Green has more on that and a roundup of other headlines.
title: House collapse in Syracuse, New York, injures 11 people

description: David Calhoun, Boeing's outgoing CEO, faced intense scrutiny from lawmakers Tuesday over safety lapses. He apologized to families of the 346 victims of the 2018 and 2019 Boeing MAX crashes.
title: Boeing CEO David Calhoun faces lawmakers, victims' families over safety issues

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un Wednesday in Pyongyang after a lavish welcoming ceremony. They vowed to build a strong front against the U.S. and deepen their military ties.
title: Putin meets with Kim Jong Un in North Korea

description: June 19th marks the third consecutive year as a federally recognized United States holiday. Some services and stores may be closed today to commemorate it.
title: Here's what is open and closed on Juneteenth

description: Pop star Justin Timberlake was arrested early Tuesday morning for allegedly driving while intoxicated in the Hamptons. Court documents state he had bloodshot eyes and a strong odor of alcohol when pulled over after allegedly running a stop sign and veering out of his lane. His next court date is scheduled for July 26.
title: Justin Timberlake arrested on DWI-related charges in Sag Harbor, New York

description: An oppressive heat wave blasts millions of Americans from the Midwest to the Northeast, while Texas braces for a likely tropical storm. Also, Boeing's CEO is met with outrage on Capitol Hill as he apologizes for the company's deadly safety failures. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Heat wave scorches Midwest, Northeast

description: A brewing tropical storm in the Gulf of Mexico could become this hurricane season's first named storm. It is expected to impact the Texas and Mexican coasts, bringing up to four feet of storm surge, flash flooding and strong wind gusts through Thursday.
title: Potential tropical storm brings warnings to Texas, Mexico

description: The South Fork and Salt Fires in New Mexico have devastated much of Ruidoso, burning over 20,000 acres and destroying at least 500 structures, with zero containment. Thousands have been evacuated as the fires continue to spread.
title: Residents evacuate as extreme heat fuels spread of wildfires in New Mexico

description: An Israeli woman recounts her ordeal as a hostage in Gaza, where she says Palestinians desperate for money helped Hamas and its allies.
title: Freed Israeli hostage says she was held in Gaza hospital, civilian homes

description: After the dramatic rescue, the calf reunited with its mother and she licked the water off its body - all of it caught on camera.
title: Video shows baby moose rescued from lake as its worried mom watches

description: Cooler weather — and perhaps rain — could bring some relief to firefighters battling blazes in southern New Mexico that killed one person, damaged hundreds of structures and forced thousands to evacuate.
title: Firefighters battling fierce New Mexico wildfires may get help from weather

description: Jim Carroll set up a spy camera and captured Mary Morrissey pouring water into his bag. He said it was soaked almost daily.
title: Lawmaker caught on video repeatedly dumping water in colleague's bag

description: Juneteenth became federally recognized in the U.S. in 2021, but the origins of the holiday and its name date back more than 150 years.
title: How did Juneteenth get its name? The story behind the holiday's title

description: Russia's Vladimir Putin pays a rare visit to North Korea, where he and Kim Jong Un vow to jointly fight "the imperialist hegemonistic policies of the U.S."
title: Putin and Kim show off "fiery friendship," pledge unity against U.S.

description: Dr. Eithan Haim, a 34-year-old surgeon, pleaded not guilty to charges that he illegally obtained confidential patient records on transgender care from Texas Children's Hospital in Houston.
title: Texas doctor charged with taking patient records on transgender care

description: Lizette Zambrano jumped in to rescue her drowning husband, then was jolted by the current and sucked in, too, according to the lawsuit.
title: Woman tried to rescue husband who died by hot tub electrocution, suit says

description: A Russian court sentenced American soldier Gordon Black almost four years in prison on charges of stealing and threats of murder, Russian news reports said.
title: U.S. soldier gets almost 4 years on theft, murder threats charges in Russia

description: Fast-spreading wildfires force evacuation of New Mexico town; How the lineage of one African-American family was traced back to 1789
title: 6/18: CBS Evening News

description: Mays was a 24-time All-Star and his iconic over-the-shoulder catch is still considered one of the greatest in the history of the game.
title: Willie Mays, one of baseball's all-time greats, dies at age 93

description: John Dickerson reports on a new immigration policy for 500,000 spouses of U.S. citizens, lawmakers' harsh questioning of Boeing's CEO on Capitol Hill, and the dangers of chemical hair relaxers.
title: 6/18: The Daily Report with John Dickerson

description: Prosecutors tried to link the alleged bribes to the appointment of Philip Sellinger, New Jersey's U.S. attorney.
title: Bob Menendez buoyed by testimony of prosecutor, former adviser in bribery trial

description: Roughly 90% of Black women have used relaxers at some point in their lives to chemically straighten their hair. New reporting in The New York Times Magazine highlights the severe and often unknown health risks these products can pose. Linda Villarosa, contributing writer for The New York Times Magazine and the report's author, joins CBS News to unpack her findings.
title: Chemicals in hair relaxers linked to serious health issues

description: The 2024 election will likely come down to how seven battleground states vote, including President Biden's home state of Pennsylvania. According to AdImpact, so far more than $21 million has been spent on campaign ads in the Keystone State -- more than any other battleground. CBS News Pittsburgh's Jon Delano looks at the race in the key state and the issues that matter most to voters there.
title: How Pennsylvania voters view 2024 presidential race

description: A little over a week from now the 2024 presidential candidates will debate for the first time this election cycle. The most important part of their job: Keeping Americans safe. Former CIA acting director Michael Morrel joins CBS News to discuss the terror danger he sees.
title: Former CIA acting director warns U.S. faces serious terrorist attack threat

description: The Israeli military has started halting its offensive during daytime hours in southern Gaza. The pause is meant to get aid into the strip, where tens of thousands are facing famine. CBS News' Chris Livesay has more details from Tel Aviv.
title: Aid fails to reach desperate Gazans due to looting

description: Tuesday, Boeing's outgoing president and CEO David Calhoun answered questions on Capitol Hill about the aerospace company's commitment to safety. The hearing follows three whistleblower allegations claiming Boeing did not address known issues and retaliated against the employees who raised them. Sharon Terlep, aerospace reporter for The Wall Street Journal, joins CBS News to discuss.
title: Senators grill Boeing CEO on safety concerns and company culture

description: In southern New Mexico, crews are battling the South Fork fire, which has grown to more than eight square miles. And in California, the Post fire has scorched more than 15,600 acres and forced evacuations of more than 1,000 people. CBS News' Carter Evans has the latest.
title: Latest on wildfires spreading in California and New Mexico

description: President Biden announced an immigration plan Tuesday to offer legal status to half a million undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens. CBS News immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez has the details.
title: Biden's new immigration plan to likely face legal challenges

description: The Blackwell's kinfolk family tree is the largest in the collections of the Library of Congress, and counts tennis great Arthur Ashe among its descendants. The Virginia family traces its genealogical history all the way back to its first African ancestor in 1789. Nikole Killion has more.
title: How the lineage of one African-American family was traced back to 1789
